Settlers themed Memory. Broken and useless, unless you actually want to play Memory, but then the other mechanics interfere with it making it something less then Memory. I formerly had this rated at .01, as it is my most hated game, but BGG seems to have modified the system to make 1 the lowest viable rating. Of all the myriad games I've played over the years, this is the worst. This game's existence makes me angry.
not so good.

Broke the game very quickly. The cards are not well balanced at all. Some are extremely overpowering and others basically worthless. I forgot the respective names but I remember that you can get 1 victory point each for obtaining the red/blue dice and there were many cards specifically designed to obtain these special victory points. However 1 victory point was just way too little to even bother. Felt like a big part of the game was just wasted.

I don't usually rate after only 1 play but I'm not sure I want to play this again. I could never get the resources I needed, my card draws were crap, and my wife just kept destroying and stealing everything I would build or collect. I eventually got so far behind it was hopeless. A very long and frustrating experience with a runaway leader problem and no fun at all.

I want to hope that it is not always like this, but it seems that the combination of this much luck and this much direct confrontation can allow for a pretty unbalanced and unpleasant game.

Willing to try again.....maybe.

2nd play (6 years later, hah!):
We played "nicely" this game, but there still appears to be a runaway leader problem. Once the momentum is going it seems hard to stop. Upgraded to 5 stars.

3rd play (6 more years later)
Another yuck. Dropped back down to 2 stars. Seems way too unbalanced and once one play gets ahead, there is no way to catch up. Bye-bye game.
Could not figure out how to play it and just fell flat
No decisions and a lot of luck. Takes a mediocre game and makes it worse.
Too much of a table hog and rules overhead for the amount of game.
I thought it was okay. I don't really need to try more versions of Catan, but I guess whatever.

Eladó

Most likely you'll be thinking if the card game version of Settlers is as good as the board game. Well, I would say the possible strategies and tactics are varied and interesting. Also, the game is slightly less luck driven and has a lot of interesting mechanisms and conflict in between players, but lacks something: The great socialising aspect of the original. This doesn't surprise me at all, as I can't see how a trading game can work with just two players.

Given that, it's almost impossible to tell if you'll like this one solely based on your feelings towards the original. Both games seem to share a lot: the resources are the same, you still build roads, settlers, cities and all, but all the negotiations and trade are gone. When you are learning to play, you'll find a lot of familiar things, but after several turns you soon discover that it's a different experience.

But, is it a good game? For me, the answer is yes: the 5 piles from which the buildings are and how all the draws/discards are handled not only is unique, but also reduces luck drastically and opens a lot of strategies. The offensive cards are very nasty and powerful, which shoots the conflict and the "take that" feeling a lot. The main flaw is the length: reducing it by 30 minutes would have been great.

All in all, a good game for two players that is fun and, while not too deep, definitely interesting, but maybe a wee bit too long.

Rating:

A reasonably fun 2-player Catan-style game. Best with expansions. A bit too much heavy and takes too long to play, there are more fun games at this level.

I like it, but sort of wishing we had the updated version.

Update: Not feeling the need for an updated version of this.

Card game re-implementation of Settlers Of Catan for 2 players. Uses some of the ideas from the original Settlers but this is essentially a unique game. Rotation of the resource cards is a clever mechanic to keep track of collected resources. Played several times over a summer trip in 2004 but haven't revisited since. We found the game ok, but nowhere near as special as Settlers. Game length is also fairly significant for a card game (1-2 hours). Decided to trade - traded along with expansion for "Tsuro" at Montreal Mathtrade February 2009.

A very interesting take on a 1v1 game in the Catan realm.

I really enjoy that the knights get a lot more personality and utility in this game and that there are also tons of Add-Ons.

But you really have to play it yourself to get a feeling of whether this is something for you or not.

-> just because you like the normal Catan, does not mean this is the game for you.

Me gusta esta versión de Catán, que solo juego a 2 jugadores. Cambia el juego tradicional por un filler que rellena un cuarto de hora; a veces la bola de nieve es imparable y las mecánicas de negociación se cambian por unas alternativas relativamente resultonas, aunque distintas a las originales. Lo de la carta del destino no me gusta y nunca he llegado a usarla (aunque, como digo, siempre lo he jugado a 2, por lo que tampoco tiene utilidad en mis partidas). Para mí, eso sí, tiene un inmenso valor sentimental que hace que vaya a conservarlo siempre, y que siempre lo mire con cariño.

A classic in my collection and my preferred Catan game. Rather random in places but I like how the game moves through different phases of expansion, early engine building and then the final push for victory where attack cards start playing a bigger role.
New Dutch edition secondhand at Spelfabriek 2025 for €10.

Minstens even tof als het originele spel. Is een meer serieus spel voor 2 spelers waar je wel eventjes zoet mee bent. Persoonlijk een van mijn favorieten. De geluksfactor ligt wel erg hoog, met enkele kaarten die een groot negatief effect kunnen hebben.

Two-Player Game

An interesting variant on the Settlers theme. I find it to be much more satisfying than regular Settlers (which I refuse to play without Cities and Knights). There is still a die rolling factor, but without the bell curve and with each player starting with every resource, it is highly minimized. The deck draw system takes getting used to, but the deck build is interesting enough to make for some good thinking.
R3

Best thing: for once this is a decent and challenging game for two! I actually enjoy this a lot more than the Settlers boardgame, mainly because it eliminates the tedious and endless trade discussions among players. Also, the knights are a lot more interesting than they were in the original.

This was a brilliant re-implementation of the board game for just 2 players. It maintains the essence of the original while improving upon depth and reducing the luck factor. It mostly does away with trading, but has other mechanics which allow you to build out your tableau.

To me this is nothing like regular Catan with the exception of using the same resources. I dislike the mechanisms of regular Catan, but I love the methods used in this game to gain and spend resources. I think the variety of cards is very good.

4/4/2023: I had never rated this before and today in memory of Klaus Teuber I’m compelled to do so. I love this game and played so much of it in the past. It’s been a while since but in my mind it’s always been a ten! This game has influenced how uplifted I feel about games in general. Thinking of it always makes me smile. To the point that I’ve given copies to others just to spread its goodness and I’ve always bought a new copy for myself. I now own the 2016 version Rivals for Catan.
Rest in Peace Mr. Teuber.
This is a great 2-player although after time, you do need the expansions to avoid getting stuck in a strategy rut.
